reviews.text: This is a beautiful building that must be fully appreciated from the outside before entering. Inside the building is also an architectural gem. The exhibits are excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Gillian who gave us superb information. We have to return as there is too much to see in one visit. The V&A is not a match for this museum.
Very good. Well worth a visit.  We had our 3 year old granddaughter with us & she so enjoyed dressing up in the creative learning area. It was fun. Cafe is extremely good too.

The new V&A could learn so much from here as to how an art institution shouldn't try to keep its visitors guessing, but rather takes pleasure in enlightening them. Superb display & information boards. 
The soaring arched ceilings, stained glass & magisterial plasterwork really uplift the visitor. A fantastic cafe too, with an extensive menu & speedy service, yet with a very relaxed atmosphere. 
All in all, one of the finest galleries/museums I've ever been to. It should be shouted from the rooftops.

The history of this building is really awesome, and they do a great job with educating you on it. I would definitely recommend sitting through the video at the start of the tour to get the history of the building. Lovely place just to wander around and soak in the art.
Nice museum in the north part of the city centre. Set in a lovely Victorian building by the DC Thompson building. A mix of natural history alongside Scottish and other paintings. Recommended.

We have had such a brilliant time from beginning to end. I never knew this place existed. The staff are so friendly, knowledge and kind. The centre has so much to see and learn. I will never look at my jute bag the same!! Food in the cafe was lovely and reasonably priced, would recommend the haggis and Scottish cheese toasties, delicious. Thank you for a lovely visit.
I didn't think it would be nearly as interesting as it was. Great to see the old machines working. Kids quite enjoyed it too.

Brilliant few hours spent here.  If you get the opportunity speak with those onsite who have worked in the mills.  Absolutely fascinating.  Well recommended.  Coffe shop attached very good for a half way tea/coffee/snack.
Excellent local museum.  Very interesting.  Somehow we managed to go round the museum back to front.  Did we miss a sign or is there not a sign telling visitors where to start?

Unfortunately I was only able to see part of the museum as I had to leave to go home, hence the reason for the 3 stars.
I will return to see the remainder.
Worth the money and the time.

Probably my absolute favourite cemetery of all times, small overall but very beautiful, calm zone in the middle of the city. For a person that likes burial grounds and cemeteries as places of relaxation, the Howff could not be a more perfect place than this for me. Lovely installations of flowers and different plants give a certain sense of contrast between the dark grey and green tombstones and structures, and the colourful vegetation. The presence of a few trees give it an even more pleasant atmosphere, but depending on how you want to imagine it, they can also give it a very ghastly, nightmare-ish feel as well, especially during winter when the trees have no leaves, feels almost as if it's coming from a horror/halloween movie. The place is absolutely beautiful
My husband was helping to survey the graveyard with a team of volunteers from the conservation team. Beautiful place of calm with interesting gravestones and history.
Lovely place, thank goodness the Local council can't do anything nasty with it, and glad who ever it was did not get permission for a resteraunt.
It's a small cemetery but it's very nice and interesting, with a little mist surrounding the graves... much better :)
Very Nice i was there 😀😀i like

We loved it at the observatory, you can see all the scenery over the Tay River from the first floor. There was unfortunately no access to the telescope that day but we still had a nice time learning about the place and the staff were super helpful and knowledge able. Only issue we had was no wheelchair access up to the other floors, but it is an old building so it's in the pipeline for changes to be made. All in all very educational place to go and we'll worth the views

We just popped in because we saw the lights on.  Turns out it is open every evening from 17:00 to 20:00 until the end of March, and then on weekends after that.  Great opportunity to star gaze.  Highly recommended on a clear evening.

Went to their planetarium show and found it very good. Took my 6 year old child with me to the show and the staff there were good as they struck the right balance of keeping the show educational and informative whilst keeping the kids amused. Once my child had seen the big telescope and heard all about it, she has not stopped asking questions about the stars and our solar system. She now wants her very own telescope for her birthday. It's just a shame that they don't attract lots of visitors as it's well worth the visit if you have young aspiring astronomers 😉

Made an impromptu visit here after seeing it on the hill. Unfortunately the dome is broken, but you can still get some beautiful views from the balcony and have a lovely natter with Stuart! (Thankyou for a wonderful chat, it was lovely to meet you)
Love this place. Lovely walk around Balgay hill that its built on and the observatory itself regularly has something, fun, free and educational on for the kids x
Excellent viewpoint to see the city. 360 degrees for miles around..
Brilliant viewpoint on a clear day. If taking a child in a pushchair ensure you avoid Law Steps! There are more than 50 of them.
Fantastic views all around particularly over the city and along the river Tay. Also great views of the Tay rail and road bridges and out as far as Broughty Ferry castle.
Nice place for a quiet walk

Love the law see all of Dundee from all
over perfect for pictures

Always one of my go to pubs. Great vibe and staff. For sure one of the better pubs in Dundee. The drinks are affordable. Can get pretty busy and loud but that’s to be expected.  Cleaned and week kept pub. Love that it allows dogs

This place is incredible! The food is absolutely amazing and so reasonably priced considering how fantastic it is. It's also dog friendly and Andrew brought our dog a bowl of water when we sat down. Can't wait to come back.

Very expansive menu with a great large projector for rugby and big sporting events! Always very accommodating staff that let you try the huge selection of guest beers but also supply the classics so nobody feels left out!

One of the best bars in Dundee and would recommend it to anybody.

Great selection of beers on tap, into allied in Dundee. You will pay for the luxury however, as drinks aren't the cheapest

Good late night scene, with music and a good crowd

Great atmosphere! Super chill with great drink options. Alex is a cool server to have too. Food was good. Enjoyed my time here. Nice place to talk cause music isn’t very loud but still fun music playlist.
Buenas opción
Excelente
Bueno
Muy bueno como siempre. Recomendado
Great place,only ordered take away but was fast and friendly.

Lovely balanced curries and great starter sharing platter. Right amount of food to wash down with a nice Tiger lager. The yogurt like dipping sauce when mixed with mango chutney on a poppadom was 'to die for' ... Still dream about it now. Nice thin melt in the mouth naan bread. Main toilet upstairs ... Not good for disabled - might have been a downstairs disabled one I didn't ask so can't confirm. Always been a good quality meal since this place opened.

We had a lovely family dinner here! I'm gluten intolerant and they don't have a gluten-free menu, but when you order, just tell them about your allergies and they'll let you know what you can have...  and my Lamb Jalfrezi and rice was delicious!  It was very flavorful and hit the spot perfectly, I would definitely recommend coming here for a curry!
Been here quite a few times and food is always fantastic
Good food made to order friendly staff
I’m always satisfied when I order from them!! And the delivery time is amazing!!!
Extra. Good. Pizza. And good deals. Too
Very good pizza and excellent customer service.

Traveling through Colorado we stayed at state park near by for 2 weeks. Had pizza from these guys 5 times and I have to admit they made great pizzas every single time. Pizza made to perfection. Best Domino's pizza I ever had. Give them a try you see what I mean
So good best pizza in the vally took kinda long but so worth it
Really nice place! Been here twice for all you can eat. The food is alright, not the best Chinese in the world! However, is alright for the price. Definitely good for a family eat out.

Food is good but hasn't changed in ten years. Always good customer service and a variety of choice for food and drinks. A nice place for a family or group of friends. Toilets are always in a state and look pretty disgusting. But apart from that, a nice place overall.

Jimmy Chung's is a great place to go for a kids party or a cheap meal if you are hungry. I see people are complaining about the price per person but actually I think it is a very reasonable price for what they offer. They are an all you can eat so if they charge too little they will obviously not be making profit. I paid £10 a person to eat as much as they can so naturally it will not be the greatest of food quality. For what it is I thoroughly enjoy going there. Yes the food can be a bit iffy but what do you expect from a restaurant that is repeatedly having to refill and refill all the containers for food. As I said earlier this is a place for kids or if you are hungry. Don't come here expecting high quality food because If you do then you clearly have no thought process. The only thing I really felt was bad was the condition of the toilets. I make sure I never go when I am there because the seats are sticky with urine and it smells bad. I cannot speak for the women's as I am a man. I feel good about Jimmy Chung's and hope they can sort the toilet problem soon!

I came in for a take away, all the food was dry or simply out.When I complaint to the waiting staff Ive been told."Its just a fiver." It might be "just" fiver for me but how about the people sitting in? Have been coming for 10 years. You lost a loyal customer today.

The worst all you can eat Chinese buffet I've ever been to. The restaurant looks very dated and in need of immediately upgrading . It doesn't look clean, light bulbs out, food should be hotter and the food was covered by old, past its best dirty looking plastic lids which were so old and worn, you can't see through. I went at lunch and the choice wasn't great. The people going looked like they'd just rolled out of bed, unwashed in track suits, greesey hair, probably all on benefits,  and all very obese. The ONLY good thing was the price. I won't be back. I wish I could give zero star.

This is a great Mexican restaurant with fantastic food and friendly, attentive staff. The decor is themed on the Mexican celebration of the Day of the Dead but is bright and colourful. We were advised which dishes could be adapted for gluten or dairy free by our knowledgeable waitress who really looked after us. The nachos to start were excellent and chicken margarita was delicious. I was told that the fajitas were excellent too and those of our party who had desserts said they were great. We really enjoyed our visit and highly recommend to anyone wanting to try excellent Mexican cuisine.
Great little warm Mexican restaurant in Dundee, highly recommend. Small but delicious menu with something for everyone. Great selection of cocktails and of course tequila.

We hadn't booked as we had been let down by another restaurant. We asked if we could have a table for 7 adults an 4 young kids and the waitresses couldn't do enough for us. Food and service was excellent.
It is a mexicana restaurant. I loved the place and the food a lot. Small cozy place with amazing food and courteous staff. I would recommend this restaurant.
Good food and atmosphere. We go for work nights out here a lot. Really good cocktails too!

Went here for the first time after looking at reviews for various local places rather than a chain restaurant...and it was well worth it. Not the cheapest place, but then again, you get great tasting food and portions, and we had really nice service. They happily exchanged items in the starters due to our preferences, and the pizzas were really tasty (though due to the size we had to take some home!). Would definitely recommend and hopefully will be back. Though probably not for three courses!

Excellent food, excellent hospitality. I've been here quite a few times now and the food had always been excellent. My daughter (who has eaten more than her fair share of pizza) commented that it was the best pizza she's ever had (in all her six years, lol). Take it from me though, it is good. Booking advised as they are usually busy.
Absolute top service. food hot when delivered and quick response time. Food was cracking! Highly recommended

As part of a prize from Wave Radio we thoroughly enjoyed a wonderful meal last night thanks to the generosity of Don Michele Restaurant. The service was excellent, food wonderful and wine outstanding. Our thanks to the staff who ensured we had a fabulous evening. We certainly hope to return before too long.
Love this place always made to feel welcom good food good prices and just a good night out.
